review: I honestly wished I never purchased this device. I consistently have issues with mine telling me it has no internet connection, even though I just searched and browsed through titles. When I am watching videos they occasionally cut off and return to the main screen or the video freezes but the sound to the video continues to play. The device is slow and lags. All in all I am glad that I didn't spend much on this item, however I wouldn't buy another one. DO YOUR SELF A FAVOR AND DO NO BUY THIS DEVICE! With the connectivity problems and not supporting all the content I would like, I would suggest just buying the regular FireTV or the Chromecast. I have a Chromecast and I LOVE it. Hope this is helpful.

author: Deb

review: I've had a Chromecast since it was released, and I was iffy about it at first. But it was a new product and it's been updated enough that I really like using it. The Fire TV Stick is a similar product to Chromecast, but I would not say that they are identical. I really like having an independent interface and remote to navigate with. Sometimes I don't want to pull something up on my phone/laptop and have to keep it on to be able to watch something via Netflix, so I like the independence of this guy. But I keep and use both of them, as it's nice to be able to cast my computer screen to the TV, and they have a little different offerings.I think it's the better present for someone who's older/less tech savvy, and maybe even for the Average Joe who wants something really simple to work with. For people who like their toys, I would say get both, for they are both interchangeable and unique.
